mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol
Class IdolInitializer

java.lang.Object
  mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol.IdolInitializer
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntityInitializer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConsoleBrowserInitializer, ServerInitializer
public abstract class IdolInitializer
extends Object
implements EntityInitializer

IdolInitializer configures an agent's state and provides a simple ControlLogic that permits the setting and inspecting of the Entity's state on the console.

Nested Class Summary
static class IdolInitializer.Console_ControlLogic

Constructor Detail

IdolInitializer

public IdolInitializer(Properties p)
                throws EntityInitializer.InitializationException
Class constructor that uses a Property to determine the initial values of the Entity's communications parameters and State fields.

The communications parameters are

  • a multicast address, a string whose value comes from the property idol.entity.mcastAddress
  • a multicast port, an integer whose value comes from the property idol.entity.mcastBasePort
  • a contact port, an integer whose value comes from the property idol.entity.contactport

The State of the Entity is initialized automatically by IdolInitializer. Derived classes may provide additional ways to initialize the State.

The process of automatic State initialization has a few rules. The rules may appear to be complicated but in practice they are simple and easy to follow.

First, IdolInitializer obtains the names of the classes that contain the names of the fields from the property idol.initializer.attributes, a comma separated list of fully qualified class names.

Second, IdolInitializer obtains the names of the fields by reflection on each of the classes in idol.initializer.attributes. The value of each public static final String field whose name ends in "FIELDNAME" becomes the name of a State field.

Third, IdolInitializer creates an ObjectFactory for each field. It constructs the name of a property that contains the name of the concrete class of the ObjectFactory from the name of the class, C, that provides the field, F, according to the pattern C.F.factory. For example, the class idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields provides the field Position, so the name of the ObjectFactory class that will construct the Position field in the State is the value of the property idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.factory.

Fourth, IdolInitializer uses each field's ObjectFactory to instantiate the value of the field from p given a property name prefix of the form C.F, as above. The prefix is the beginning of the names of properties of p that the ObjectFactory may use to instantiate the field. Each ObjectFactory has its own requirements for naming the values it uses to instantiate its class of object.

Here is an example of a properties file. It is part of the properties file for one of the sample client Entities. 

           idol.initializer.attributes=mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields
           idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.factory=mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.Vector3dFactory
           idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.x=0
           idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.y=0
           idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.z=0

idol.initializer.attributes names a single class, mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields, that provides the names of the fields of the Entity's state.

The Position field is initialized by an ObjectFactory of class mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.Vector3dFactory.

The properties idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.x, idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.y, and idol.mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields.Position.z are potential inputs to the Vector3dFactory.

Here is an excerpt from a version of mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal.QueryClientFields. According to the automatic field initialization convention described above, POSITION_FIELDNAME, a public static final String field, contains the name of a field in the Entity's State. The name of that field is "Position". 

           package mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.spatiotemporal;

           public final class QueryClientFields 
           {
             public static final String POSITION_FIELDNAME = "Position";
           ...
           };

Initialization of the ControlLogic is determined by the derived classes.

Parameters:
p - the Properties of the Entity

IdolInitializer.Console_ControlLogic, ObjectFactory
Method Detail

initialize_getFieldNames

private final Set initialize_getFieldNames(String className)
Collects the names of the automatically initialized State fields. initialize_getFieldNames searches the class named by className for public static final String fields whose names end in "FIELDNAME". The values of these fields will be the names of the State fields.

Parameters:
className - the fully qualified name of a class
Returns:
a set of strings that are the names of the fields

initialize_loadDefaultFieldValues

                                                     Set fns,
                                                     Properties p)
Initializes the fields of _state given the name of an ObjectFactory, a set of field names, and a Properties that may contain initialization hints.

Parameters:
className - the name of the ObjectFactory class
fns - the set of field names (Strings)
p - the properties for initializing the fields

getMcastAddress

public final String getMcastAddress()
Description copied from interface: EntityInitializer
Returns the String representation of the multicast address. It can be null. It can be a point-to-point address. The Entity uses multicast to transmit state changes to its clients.

Specified by:
getMcastAddress in interface EntityInitializer
Returns:
the multicast address

getMcastBasePort

public final int getMcastBasePort()
Description copied from interface: EntityInitializer
The Entity uses a range of ports on its multicast address. Using a range of ports permits the Entity to multicast different qualities of service to its clients. The port numbers begin with the value returned by getMcastBasePort() and increases thereafter with each new Projector.

Specified by:
getMcastBasePort in interface EntityInitializer
Returns:
the starting port number.
